body: @ankitabhopatkar13 Please show the content of `aws/test.yaml` and `aws/accp.yaml`. thanks very much.

Thanks for the reply @yxxhero

`aws/test.yaml` contains the key values like -

```
global:
  environment: test

appChartName:
  enabed: true
  image:
    tag: 0.0.1
```

It has nothing regarding the service or it's port.

`aws/accp.yaml` doesn't have anything yet and is also not used during the helm deployment.

This is both a rare and good question. When it comes to handling `exports` the code is [here](https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/a499b4b179307c267bdf3ec49b880e3dbd2a5591/pkg/chartutil/dependencies.go#L219-L274). The docs on `exports` can be found [here](https://helm.sh/docs/topics/charts/#using-the-exports-format).

@ankitabhopatkar13 Can you provide the `dependencies` section of your app chart? Is there an `imports` section?

Yes, the dependencies section of the app chart does have an imports section.

The library chart has exports as defaults like -

```
exports:
  defaults:
     service:
       type: ClusterIP
       port: 9090
```

And the app chart uses them like -

```
dependencies:
- name: lib-chart
  version: 0.1.0
  repository: path_to_repo
  import-values:
    - defaults
```

Just to elaborate a bit -

The precedence is only getting changed when a values file is passed with `--values` flag while installing the Umbrella chart. But if there is no `--values` flag and when the values are getting read from default `values.yaml` file, the precedence works just fine.

`helm upgrade --install release release --values aws/test.yaml` -----> exported values from library chart takes precedence over app chart values.

`helm upgrade --install release release` -----> app chart values take precedence over library chart values(which is what seems the right order).

@mattfarina I have added a sample code structure for reproduction and also the results in the README -

https://github.com/ankitabhopatkar13/helm-values-issue
@ankitabhopatkar13 Thank you for providing that example. I've updated this to be marked as a bug.

Generally speaking the community submits bugs and provides patches. We don’t have enough time to provide patches for every bug report; we rely on community contributions for that. The exception to the rule being security-related issues, which are handled by the security team.

Please feel free to provide a patch and we’d be happy to take a look.

issue.title: Fix value precedence

issue.body:
Fix value precedence when importing values from child, as described in issue https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/9940

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

 Closes https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/9940

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains documentation
- [x] this PR contains unit tests
- [ ] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body: This issue has been marked as stale because it has been open for 90 days with no activity. This thread will be automatically closed in 30 days if no further activity occurs.
